cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 mi (100 km) W of San Andres Island
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across Nicaragua/Honduras, then forecast to emerge into the north-western Caribbean on Friday before accelerating north-northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward the central Gulf Coast (LA–FL panhandle) this weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast near southeast Louisiana or Mississippi coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A (only Nicaragua–Honduras coast under warning at this time)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central America (Nicaragua, Honduras), Yucatan Peninsula, and U.S. central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Low probability (≤4%) of tropical-storm-force winds; expected gusts generally below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal departures (<2 ft) possible but significant surge not expected for Lake Charles given forecast track east of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of intermittent rain possible as outer rain-bands brush western Louisiana late Sunday into Monday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated beyond brief heavy showers that could temporarily reduce visibility and create slick surfaces on terminal areas.
